001package io.jstach.rainbowgum.jdk.jul;
002
003import java.util.logging.Logger;
004
005import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogConfig;
006import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperties;
007import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperty.Property;
008import io.jstach.rainbowgum.LogProperty.RequiredProperty;
009import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider;
010import io.jstach.rainbowgum.spi.RainbowGumServiceProvider.Configurator;
011import io.jstach.svc.ServiceProvider;
012
013/**
014 * Will install the JUL handler if it is not already set and the level of the loggers.
015 */
016@ServiceProvider(RainbowGumServiceProvider.class)
017public final class JULConfigurator implements Configurator, AutoCloseable {
018
019        /**
020         * If true will not install the JUL handler.
021         */
022        public static final String JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY = "logging.jul.disable";
023
024        /**
025         * If true will not set the root loggers level to whatever the curreint rainbow gums
026         * global level default is.
027         */
028        public static final String JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY = "logging.jul.level.disable";
029
030        static final RequiredProperty<Boolean> JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_ = Property.builder()
031                .toBoolean() //
032                .orElse(false) //
033                .build(JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY);
034
035        static final RequiredProperty<Boolean> JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_ = Property.builder()
036                .toBoolean() //
037                .orElse(false) //
038                .build(JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY);
039
040        /**
041         * For service laoder.
042         */
043        public JULConfigurator() {
044        }
045
046        @Override
047        public boolean configure(@SuppressWarnings("exports") LogConfig config) {
048                if (!install(config.properties())) {
049                        return true;
050                }
051                var disableLevel = JUL_LEVEL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_.get(config.properties()).value();
052
053                if (!disableLevel) {
054                        var logger = Logger.getLogger("");
055                        if (logger != null) {
056                                var systemLevel = traceToAll(config.levelResolver().resolveLevel(""));
057                                logger.setLevel(julLevel(systemLevel));
058                        }
059                }
060                return true;
061
062        }
063
064        private static System.Logger.Level traceToAll(System.Logger.Level level) {
065                if (level == System.Logger.Level.TRACE) {
066                        return System.Logger.Level.ALL;
067                }
068                return level;
069        }
070
071        /**
072         * Will install the JUL handler if not disabled by properties. This method is
073         * currently exposed for testing purposes.
074         * @param properties properties to check
075         * @return true if enabled.
076         * @hidden
077         */
078        public static boolean install(@SuppressWarnings("exports") LogProperties properties) {
079                if (JUL_DISABLE_PROPERTY_.get(properties).value()) {
080                        return false;
081                }
082
083                if (!SystemLoggerQueueJULHandler.isInstalled()) {
084                        SystemLoggerQueueJULHandler.install();
085                }
086                return true;
087
088        }
089
090        /**
091         * Will test if already installed. This is mainly for testing purpsoes.
092         * @return true if installed.
093         * @hidden
094         */
095        public static boolean isInstalled() {
096                return SystemLoggerQueueJULHandler.isInstalled();
097        }
098
099        @Override
100        public void close() {
101                var logger = Logger.getLogger("");
102                if (logger != null) {
103                        logger.setLevel(java.util.logging.Level.INFO);
104                }
105
106        }
107
108        private java.util.logging.Level julLevel(System.Logger.Level level) {
109                var julLevel = switch (level) {
110                        case TRACE -> java.util.logging.Level.FINEST;
111                        case DEBUG -> java.util.logging.Level.FINE;
112                        case INFO -> java.util.logging.Level.INFO;
113                        case WARNING -> java.util.logging.Level.WARNING;
114                        case ERROR -> java.util.logging.Level.SEVERE;
115                        case ALL -> java.util.logging.Level.ALL;
116                        case OFF -> java.util.logging.Level.OFF;
117                };
118                return julLevel;
119        }
120
121}
